TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XmlDocumentType extends System.Xml.XmlLinkedNode

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocumentType> class can be used to return information about a document type declaration. Use the <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument.CreateDocumentType%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to create an <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocumentType> object.

MemberSignature.Value: protected XmlDocumentType (string name, string publicId, string systemId, string internalSubset, System.Xml.XmlDocument doc);

The system identifier; see the property.
The DTD internal subset; see the property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Do not instantiate an <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocumentType> directly; instead, use members such as <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument.DocumentType%2A> to obtain one.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Xml.XmlNode CloneNode(bool deep) cil managed

Docs.param: to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; to clone only the node itself. For document type nodes, the cloned node always includes the subtree, regardless of the parameter setting.
Docs.summary: Creates a duplicate of this node.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method serves as a copy constructor for nodes. The cloned node has no parent (<xref:System.Xml.XmlNode.ParentNode%2A> returns `null`).
To see how this method behaves with other node types, see <xref:System.Xml.XmlNode.CloneNode%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of nodes declared in the document type declaration.
Docs.value: An containing the nodes. The returned is read-only.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The order in which the entities are returned is not based on the order in which these items may appear in the document. The order is also not guaranteed to be the same between similar documents, or between different implementations or versions of the class.
## Examples The following example displays information about the entities declared in the XML document.
[!code-cpp[XmlEntity#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlEntity/CPP/entities.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[XmlEntity#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlEntity/CS/entities.cs#1)] [!code-vb[XmlEntity#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlEntity/VB/entities.vb#1)]
The example uses the file `doment.xml` as input.
[!code-xml[XmlEntity#2](~/samples/snippets/xml/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlEntity/XML/doment.xml#2)]

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the document type definition (DTD) internal subset on the DOCTYPE declaration.
Docs.value: The DTD internal subset on the DOCTYPE. If there is no DTD internal subset, String.Empty is returned.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example displays information about the DocumentType node.
[!code-cpp[Classic WebData XmlDocumentType.Name Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Data/Classic WebData XmlDocumentType.Name Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic WebData XmlDocumentType.Name Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/Classic WebData XmlDocumentType.Name Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic WebData XmlDocumentType.Name Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/Classic WebData XmlDocumentType.Name Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the node is read-only.
Docs.value:
if the node is read-only; otherwise .
Because DocumentType nodes are read-only, this property always returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A read-only node is one whose properties, attributes, or children cannot be changed. However, you can remove a read-only node from the tree and insert it somewhere else.
You can remove a `XmlDocumentType` from a document and reinsert it back into the document as long as the document does not have an element node. Once a document has a root element, its `XmlDocumentType` cannot be changed.
This property is a Microsoft extension to the Document Object Model (DOM).
## Examples The following example displays information about the DocumentType node.
[!code-cpp[Classic WebData XmlDocumentType.IsReadOnly Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Data/Classic WebData XmlDocumentType.IsReadOnly Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic WebData XmlDocumentType.IsReadOnly Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/Classic WebData XmlDocumentType.IsReadOnly Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic WebData XmlDocumentType.IsReadOnly Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/Classic WebData XmlDocumentType.IsReadOnly Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets the local name of the node.
Docs.value: For DocumentType nodes, this property returns the name of the document type.

Docs.summary: Gets the qualified name of the node.
Docs.value: For DocumentType nodes, this property returns the name of the document type.

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Gets the type of the current node.
Docs.value: For DocumentType nodes, this value is XmlNodeType.DocumentType.

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of nodes present in the document type declaration.
Docs.value: An containing the nodes. The returned is read-only.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The order in which the notations are returned is not based on the order in which these items may appear in the document. The order is also not guaranteed to be the same between similar documents, or between different implementations or versions of the class.

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the public identifier on the DOCTYPE declaration.
Docs.value: The public identifier on the DOCTYPE. If there is no public identifier, is returned.

Docs.value: The system identifier on the DOCTYPE. If there is no system identifier, is returned.
